item.title: Avowed: All Galawain's Tusk Totem Pieces
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where to Find the Fragments of the Spoils Document in Avowed
  • Galawain's Tusk Totem Core Location – Avowed
  • Antler of Perservering Stag Location – Avowed
  • Antler of Pursued Stag Location – Avowed
  • Wolf's Pelt Trophy Location – Avowed
  • Hunter's Arrows of Seeking Location – Avowed
  • Hunter's Arrows of Slaying Location – Avowed
  • Hunter's Arrows of Surviving Location – Avowed
  • All Totem of Perseverance Perks – Avowed

The Totem of Perserverance is the fourth and final totem that makes up Avowed 's Totem Shrine . Like all previous totems, every piece of this will be found in a single region. In this case, the region is Galawain's Tusk . Collecting every piece of the totem to Galawain will unlock the final six totem boons. In this guide, we'll show you where to find all totem pieces in Galawain's Tusk , and reveal the perks that each piece offers.

Where to Find the Fragments of the Spoils Document in Avowed

All four of the totems in Avowed feature a document that provides clues to the location of each individual piece. They are always sold by a single merchant, and always for 500 gold. In this case, the document – titled " Fragments of the Spoils " – is sold by Quartermaster Yorgu at Solace Keep.

If you haven't visited Solace Keep yet, head to the center of the eastern edge of Galawain's Tusk. There, you'll find the bridge leading into the castle. To gain access, you'll have to speak to Warden Kosmin.

We always brought Marius with us when attempting to enter the keep for the first time. There were never any issue and we were allowed to pass. However, the outcome may be different if you do not bring Marius.

Inside the keep, if you face the large statue in the center of the main hall, you'll find Yorgu in the far right corner behind the statue. You can purchase the document directly from him.

Galawain's Tusk Totem Core Location – Avowed

The first item listed on the document, and in the quest description, is the Totem Core . The riddle is as follows:

Where fungal forest halts, among the ruins the Changeling's totem exalts.

  • Riddle Solution: Shrine to Galawain

The Shrine to Galawain is in the Twinedwood region of Galawain's Tusk, just southwest of the Solace Keep Party Camp. There will be two massive Ogres in the main courtyard of the shrine. After taking them out, head up the steps to the larger of the two main platforms, and you'll see a special shrine area with its own small set of stairs leading to it. The Totem Core is on a small podium in the center of this shrine area.

Remember that in Avowed, the Totem Base for each of the four totems must be collected before you can place any of the pieces at the Totem Shrine. This is why you'll see "Totem Base Required" if you approach the shrine without it.

Antler of Perservering Stag Location – Avowed

The second piece listed on the document is the Antler of the Persevering Stag. The riddle is as follows:

Below a bridge above the acid sea, the first of the elk's remains shall be...

  • Riddle Solution: Bridge to the Garden

During the first real mission in Galawain's Tusk, titled " Our Dreams Divide Us Still ", you will be tasked with locating the Steel Garrote near the Bridge to the Garden in the southeastern corner of the map.

If you start from the location shown on the above map, you can follow the path to a small ledge under the broken bridge. On this ledge, you'll find the Antler of the Persevering Stag next to a dead body.

Antler of Pursued Stag Location – Avowed

The third clue offered in "Fragments of the Spoils" will lead you to the Antler of the Pursued Stag. The riddle is as follows:

Past disused tower guarding lava fields, by stone and bramble this antler is revealed

  • Riddle Solution : North of Pargrun Cache

This totem piece is found in a secret cave north of the Galawain's Tusk Pagrun Cache. The cache is found northwest of the Lost Village where Marius' companion quest takes you.

  • Make sure you bring Yazli, as she'll need to dispel illusions.

The easiest way to reach this location is to start from the Primordial Depths North Beacon, then head directly north through the broken gap in the spiked fence. Cross the lava river, then enter the cave. Be careful, as there are multiple spiders you'll have to deal with. You'll notice a small hole in the wall of the cave, as well as a larger exit heading into a room with lava. The small hole leads to the same chamber, so you can choose either.

Burn the brambles on the upper level, then make your way up to the exit of the second cave chamber. When you exit the final tunnel, you'll see the Pagrun Cache structure directly ahead. Turning left out of the tunnel will take you to the cache, but you want to turn right. Continue down the path until you see Xaurip paintings on the rock wall to the right. Stop there, and turn. You should see an illusory wall blocking a cave entrance.

Inside the cave, you'll see a large bramble wall that you must burn. The Antler of the Pursued Stag is in a small hut behind the bramble wall.

Immediately after collecting the Antler, you can collect the final Hunter's Arrows of Surviving. Check the final section to see the route. In short, you turn left at the Pargrun Cache instead of right, then stay along the left rock wall until you reach an old Godless ruin.

Wolf's Pelt Trophy Location – Avowed

The fourth riddle in "Fragments of the Spoils" will lead you to the Wolf's Pelt Trophy piece. The wording is as follows:

The lupine pelt will heed your call, on ashen tower where the sky did fall

  • Riddle Solution: Ash Forest Outpost

If you've started or completed the "Homecoming" mission, you've likely already got a mission marker or fast-travel beacon that can guide you to the area of the Wolf's Pelt Trophy. If you have access, travel to the Ash Forest Beacon in the northwest corner of Galawain's Tusk.

Head to the western edge of the Ash Forest, and you'll discover the Ash Forest Outpost. You need to make it to the top of the southernmost structure. If you look on the around the left side of the structure, you'll see a series of rock ledges that you can climb. At the top of the ledges, you can jump and reach the top of the outpost building.

On top of the building, you'll find the Wolf's Pelt Trophy sitting on the ground near a crate and a great hammer.

Hunter's Arrows of Seeking Location – Avowed

The fifth passage will take you to the summit of Mt. Forja to find the Hunter's Arrows of Seeking. The riddle states the following:

Near the founder's head these arrows find, out of view where he is blind

  • Riddle Solution: Mt. Forja Summit/Mines

You can reach the summit of Mt. Forja simply by following the " Our Dreams Divide Us Still " main mission. After you defeat the boss (this is a major spoiler, you'll know it when you see it) at the summit of Mt. Forja, you can head up a short path along the side of the summit and find the Hunter's Arrows of Seeking near a chest.

Hunter's Arrows of Slaying Location – Avowed

The sixth passage in "Fragments of the Spoils" lead you to the Hunter's Arrow of Slaying . The riddle states:

In the fallen spire amidst fields of slumber, a wooden trio waits to be discovered

  • Riddle Solution: Slumbering Fields Ruins

To find the Hunter's Arrows of Slaying, start from the Slumbering Fields Beacon , in the region of the same name. The Slumbering Fields are located in the eastern section of Galawain's Tusk, and are the only area on the map that is visibly green.

From the beacon, head north under the first arch. Continue north, and you'll see another arch with a rock bridge on top. Pass under the second arch and follow the dirt path until it comes to a T. At the cross, turn left and continue under the third arch. Follow the path to the top of the small incline.

At the top of the hill, you'll see a large rock feature with what appears to be a root in the shape of a circular crown. Use the rock platforms on the right side of the structure to make your way up to the top. There, you'll see a large hole in a rock wall that leads into a small open chamber.

In the chamber, you'll find the Hunter's Arrows of Slaying in a chest.

Hunter's Arrows of Surviving Location – Avowed

The final riddle in "Fragments of the Spoils" will take you to the Godless ruins by the Lost Village. The passage states:

The final shafts you shall seek in a silent village where spirits still shriek.

  • Riddle Solution: Lost Village

The Hunter's Arrows of Surviving are found very close to the Antler of the Persevering Stag. Instead of turning right after exiting the cave at the Pargrun Cache, turn left and make your way up the rock ledges.

At the top of the rock ledge, you can see a domed ruin to the southeast. Make your way across the rocky path and enter the ruined structure. Inside, you'll find the Hunter's Arrows of Surviving on a small table.

All Totem of Perseverance Perks – Avowed

Perk Name

Perk Description

Quarry to Slaughter

Increases damage to prone enemies by 75%

Bloodied Hands

Critical hits deal high Bleed accumulation

Hunting Howl

Second Wind casts Barbaric Shout

In Victory's Raiment

Killing an enemy gives you +4% damage reduction for 10 seconds

The Changeling's Power

+2 Might, +2 Constitution

On Victory's Heels

Killing an enemy gives you +2-% Move Speed for 10 seconds

item.title: Animal Crossing: New Horizons Player Recreates David Lynch's Twin Peaks
item.description:
Summary

  • Creative fan of Animal Crossing: New Horizons uses the game's customization tools to recreate iconic scenes from David Lynch's works in tribute to the late director.
  • Players can explore, redecorate, and develop a deserted island in this top-selling game, praised for its impressive customization features and creative potential.
  • The surrealism of David Lynch's works continues to inspire fans to recreate his legacy in video games like Animal Crossing: New Horizons, showcasing the impact of his storytelling on modern pop culture.

After the passing of surrealist film director David Lynch, a number of gaming fans took to life-sim titles to recreate some of his greatest works, including one Animal Crossing: New Horizons player who remade iconic moments from Lynch's Twin Peaks . Animal Crossing: New Horizons is generally considered a family-friendly wholesome game, but this fan found that Animal Crossing 's extensive customization tools were perfect for reproducing the mystery-horror atmosphere of one of David Lynch's greatest legacies.

Originally released in 2020, Animal Crossing: New Horizons sees players starting out on a small deserted island, which they can explore, redecorate, and develop. The game has been praised as one of the best offerings in the Animal Crossing video game franchise and is among one of the top-selling games on the Nintendo Switch. Boasting some rather impressive customization features, it should come as no surprise that imaginative fans use the game's tools to produce creative designs.

Animal Crossing: New Horizons player lonely_purple_space shared a photo gallery of their in-game recreation of David Lynch's Twin Peaks . The bizarre yet captivating television series Twin Peaks premiered in April 1990 and focuses on Special Agent Dale Cooper, as he investigates the death of a teenage girl. Agent Cooper encounters some truly uncanny characters and mind-bending scenarios, which are ironically balanced with offbeat humor and an uptempo musical score. The show has gained a cult following over the years and is largely considered one of David Lynch's greatest projects. In memory of the great director, OP recreated the mysterious drama series with the customization tools in Animal Crossing: New Horizons . They reproduced the show's opening car scene, the iconic Black Lodge location, and even the diner, complete with a slice of cherry pie that Twin Peaks fans will instantly recognize.

Twin Peaks in Animal Crossing: New Horizons

David Lynch fans quickly voiced their appreciation for the Animal Crossing: New Horizons recreation of Twin Peaks . Many spotted the subtle Easter eggs and details from the show that OP captured in the reproduction, with several commenters stating that they were inspired to make their own Twin Peaks islands in the game. From this impressive reproduction of Twin Peaks in Animal Crossing: New Horizons to a David Lynch shrine in Stardew Valley , the late director's legacy continues to spark creativity among gaming fans.

While the surrealism of Lynchian storytelling and visuals have perplexed many over the years, others have adored the out-of-the-box presentation that gives audiences as much agency in Lynch's works as the characters themselves. With a number of video games inspired by David Lynch and customization-focused titles like Animal Crossing: New Horizons , fans have a variety of ways to share their love of the director's work in their favorite games.

item.title: Exoborne Hands-On Preview
item.description:
Tencent's upcoming Exoborne is perhaps one of the most brutally generic extraction shooters yet. The game, which is slated for a release this spring on all platforms but Nintendo Switch, borrows quite a bit from the likes of Marauders and Escape from Tarkov , but it unfortunately doesn't do much to differentiate itself.

Exoborne is set in the not-too-distant future, wherein Earth has been ravaged by extreme weather events courtesy of aggressive climate change, and an evil corporation known as Rebirth has seized power over the ashes. That's about all that Exoborne offers in terms of narrative thus far, and this premise seems designed more to justify its unique weather systems and post-apocalyptic backdrop than to weave an enthralling tale. Nevertheless, it is upon this narrative foundation that Exoborne 's gameplay is built, and while it's good for a bit of paint-by-numbers multiplayer action, it never quite goes beyond that.

After several hours with Exoborne , I can't bring myself to get past how frightfully bland it is. Just about every element of the experience feels like a who's who of contemporary AAA game design tropes, from the gunplay and exploration, to the lore and music, to even the game's very title, which comes across like a marriage of soft sci-fi aesthetics and AI-generated babble. The result of this uninspired design left me feeling dispirited and worn out by Exoborne long before I should have been, making it hard to look forward to its full release.

What Exoborne Is Bringing to the Extraction Shooter Banquet

Like any gold rush video game genre, the extraction shooter space is characterized by games that attempt to break through the noise via key points of difference. In the case of Hunt: Showdown , this manifests in a unique Americana-infused, turn-of-the-century dark fantasy setting, while Escape from Tarkov stands out for its quasi-simulation mechanics and attention to detail. One can debate the merits of any of these games, but the crowded market in which they exist demands originality and ingenuity.

Exoborne 's ostensible point of difference is its bevy of dynamic weather effects which, to the game's credit, can wind up having a fairly significant impact on a given run. Destructive tornadoes, rainstorms, and firestorms can change how the player engages with the game, redirecting them away from certain areas, flinging them high into the air, or muffling their footsteps so that they can get the drop on enemies. Whether these environmental hazards help or hinder you will depend on how well you can adapt, which lends Exoborne a much-needed sense of unpredictability.

Exoborne gives players a parachute that they can use to ride the winds of certain storms, allowing for rapid and chaotic traversal. This speedy flight system, coupled with a rechargeable grapple hook, forms the backbone of the game's surprisingly satisfying movement mechanics.

Having said that, one should probably not expect too much from Exoborne 's dynamic weather effects, as the game is no innovator in this respect. While it's nice that something like a massive tornado can shake up a gameplay session, the ways that players actually engage with such emergent factors is rather shallow. Yes, a tornado can fling you into the air, and fog will make it harder for you to see, but these are hardly transformative effects, and they essentially have the same effect as similar meteorological variables in other open-world games like Breath of the Wild . More often than not, the impact that inclement weather has is short-term or unsubstantial, and with this feature being particularly visible in Exoborne 's marketing, it was disappointing to see how limited it actually is, at least in this preview build.

Exoborne Nails Its Genre Fundamentals, but That May Not Be Enough

Exoborne 's gameplay loop is standard for the extraction shooter genre: players deploy into the massive map of Colton County, complete objectives, and gather as much loot as possible before exfiltrating. You can play Exoborne solo or with up to two other players, but you will inevitably run into both hostile bots and other, player-controlled squads, all of whom are hungry for your loot. Whatever you bring with you in a given session will be lost upon defeat, so creating a loadout is about measuring risk versus reward—an interplay that defines much of the Exoborne experience.

The PvPvE structure of the Exoborne is informed by areas of low, medium, and high risk, with high-risk areas, naturally, being more dangerous while providing higher-quality loot. Even if you're not the first to reach one of these loot hotspots, you can let another player do the heavy lifting before taking them out and stealing what they've collected, which provides a strong incentive to keep seeking out conflict. It's a tried-and-true gameplay formula, and just like in every other well-designed, functional extraction shooter, it can be quite a bit of fun, at least for a while.

The real proving ground for Exoborne will be how it continues to develop its loot-progression connection. Right now, gathering loot and earning valuable in-game resources is only rewarding in the short-term, since playing around with different character builds is a bit underbaked and, in accordance with the rest of the game, very bland. You can unlock new Exosuits with unique stats and abilities, but these mostly boil down to special moves like an area-of-effect ground slam or a crowd-control force burst. These abilities don't lend themselves much to experimentation, nor do they have a significant or unexpected impact on moment-to-moment gameplay.

It's a similar story with guns: unlocking new ones and upgrading what you have is useful, but it doesn't meaningfully change how the game is played. Ultimately, gathering loot feels underwhelming after the first few matches, as it doesn't lead to interesting rewards; repeated runs start to feel repetitive remarkably quickly.

Final Thoughts

At the end of the day, the most concerning aspect of Exoborne is that it feels like a game for no one. If you've struggled to get into the extraction shooter genre before, then this game is very unlikely to be the one that converts you, as it is among the most milquetoast of the bunch. Alternatively, if you're knee-deep in the extraction shooter space, you might be better off waiting for new content for your regular haunts, especially since Exoborne is planned to be a premium release.

If you are really itching for something new to play, then Exoborne could provide you with a few hours of no-frills action—it's not unplayable or frustrating by any means. But it is a boring and derivative project at this stage, and while I tried repeatedly to see past its unimaginative aesthetic wrapping, its core gameplay and early progression systems never did enough to evoke more than a passing interest. Sadly, it is remarkably unremarkable, and hard to feel enthusiastic about.

item.title: New Pokemon TCG Expansion Cards Revealed
item.description:
Summary

  • New Pokemon TCG cards featuring Cynthia and other favorites are well-received by players.
  • Hot Wind Arena subset set for release in Japan on March 14 with over 60 collectible cards.
  • Cynthia's cards generating excitement among fans for upcoming releases in Japan and the West.

New Pokemon TCG cards featuring Cynthia and her Pokemon have been revealed, and players are delighted with them. The cards will be part of the next Pokemon TCG release coming soon and will feature some characters that are well-known to fans.

This release will be the Hot Wind Arena subset, which will be released in Japan on March 14. Each box will come with 30 booster packs, while the subset itself will have over 60 cards to collect. One of the highlights of Hot Wind Arena will be Cynthia, the memorable Sinnoh Champion, who will appear alongside cards featuring Ethan, the main character from Pokemon Gold and Silver , Misty, and Arven, the players' rival in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet and their pocket monsters. Increasing the hype for the release of the subset, new news about them has been shared.

Redditor manlytom1995 shared the Cynthia cards that will be in the upcoming Pokemon TCG subset. Recently shown at the Champions League Fukuoka tournament, there will be seven cards featuring the character and her partners, with cards from the Garchomp and Roserade evolutionary lines, as well as Spiritbomb. The seventh card is Cynthia's Power Weight, a tool that increases HP only if used in Cynthia's Pokemon. Two highlights from this group of cards are Garchomp ex, and Roserade, which has received a beautiful full art card alongside their trainer.

New Pokemon TCG Cards Revealed, and Players Love Them

The new Pokemon TCG cards shared by the OP left the comments section in love, since Cynthia is one of the most popular characters among Pokemon fans. One of the comments said that for them, her card with Roserade will be their chase card. Another fan expressed their pleasure with the artwork for the same card, positively impressed with the design, giving the character a different look. A third Pokemon fan commented that, for them, the features of Cynthia's cards reminded him of old cartoons such as Gundam and Sailor Moon .

While Heat Wave Arena will be a release for Pokemon TCG fans in Japan, those in the West will soon have access to some of these cards. A new, previously leaked, English Pokemon TCG expansion called Destined Rivals is set for release on May 30, with pre-release taking place from May 17 to 25. The set is expected to feature Ethan's Ho-Oh ex and Cynthia's Garchomp ex, as well as Steven's Metagross ex, Grimmsnarl ex, and Team Rocket's Mewtwo ex.

item.title: Wuthering Waves: All Support Characters, Ranked
item.description:
Supports in Wuthering Waves are as important as DPS units during combat. They set the field ready for the team’s main DPS to deal an incredible amount of DMG. Of course, they can do that if they have good buffs on top of dealing DMG or providing some sustainability.

This Support tier list in Wuthering Waves will help players distinguish between the good Supports and the ones that may hold their teams back, but first, keep in mind that the definition of "support" may differ for every player. For instance, a sub-DPS + buffer may be considered as Support for some but not for others, like Sanhua . In this article, the focus will lean more toward buffing, healing, and coordinated attacks.

11 Taoqi

C-Tier

Taoqi has one of the longest on-field time in Wuthering Waves . Although she can shield and heal her team, she still takes too long to set that up. Her attacks and Resonance Skill hits are so slow and hard to hit, that it makes her suffer to help her team. Taoqi also doesn’t have a certain stat she scales with as her attacks and Supportive abilities scale differently, further hurting her role as a Support.

Basically, the only good thing about Taoqi is her strong Resonance Skill DMG. That is if you are able to fill her Concerto energy.

10 Yuanwu

C-Tier

Yuanwu is a character that carries many supportive abilities into his kit. He’s a decent shielder who can grant his team some extra resistance to interruption. He also buffs his team’s DEF% alongside placing an Electric field that launches coordinated attacks with the active character.

Unfortunately for Yuanwu, all the available characters don’t benefit from his kit as nobody yet exclusively scales with DEF% and there are much better characters when it comes to coordinated attacks. For now, Yuanwu sits far away in most Support lists in Wuthering Waves .

9 Yangyang

B-Tier

One of the best qualities of Yangyang is her ability to leave the field after a few seconds of getting on it. Her Outro Skill will battery the next character’s energy, allowing them to cast their Resonance Liberation more often. She can also collect enemies with her acceptable CC abilities, which further help the next character to be effective with their AoE.

She also buffs her team’s ATK by 20%, although that’s still not enough to put Yangyang in a comparable spot against other Supports in Wuthering Waves .

8 Jianxin

B-Tier

Jianxin has a kit that can do everything in Wuthering Waves . She’s a good shielder with a minor ability to heal. She can deal an acceptable DMG if her build supports that kind of gameplay. She even has a great Resonance Liberation buff from her Outro Skill, which makes her a good pair with characters that depend on their Ults, like Carlotta in Wuthering Waves .

Having many utilities but not excelling in any of them will always be bad for the character as Jianxin can’t fully succeed in any role. She’s outmatched and outperformed in every role she can take, putting her in the lower rank of this Wuthering Waves ’ Support tier list.

7 Youhu

B-Tier

Youhu can work well with coordinated attack teams like the Zhezhi and Jinhsi’s teams in Wuthering Waves . She’s also a useful character to include in Mortefi and Jiyan's teams. Other than her team healing, Youhu will increase the next character’s coordinated attacks DMG by 100% through her Outro Skill.

Although Youhu can buff and heal, she’s still not a match to other healers in Wuthering Waves . As a 4-star Support, it’s enough for her to reside in the middle of most tier lists.

6 Baizhi

A-Tier

Baizhi is a decent healer who carries small buffs to her team during combat. Her buffs aren’t lost upon switching, which makes her a good choice for many teams in Wuthering Waves . As a healer, you can build Baizhi with the Rejuvenating Glow set to grant her an ATK% buff to the entire team. Not only that, but giving Baizhi Bell-Borne Geochelone will further buff the team’s DMG by 10%.

Baizhi also has useful Sequences, like her S5 and S6, that further improve her performance as a Support. Her S5 revives fallen allies at 100% HP, while her S6 gives her a Glacio DMG buff to make her more valuable in Glacio teams.

5 Mortefi

S-Tier

Since the start, Mortefi has been one of the best Sub-DPS in Wuthering Waves . His partnership with Jiyan puts both units at a higher rank in most players’ tier lists. Mortefi rains fire on enemies with his coordinated attacks (that's generated by his Resonance Liberation) as long as the main DPS is hitting enemies with their Heavy Attacks.

What makes Mortefi so good is his Outro Skill that greatly buffs the next character’s Heavy Attacks, which dictates what his team should be all about.

4 Yinlin

S-Tier

Yinlin can be a strong buffer in Wuthering Waves , which makes her a decent Support to include in Electro teams. She’s also capable of dealing a lot of AoE DMG, especially in her quick-swap teams. Her Outro Skill allows her to buff the next character’s Electro and Resonance Liberation DMG by 20 and 25% respectively.

Those buffs make Yinlin one of the best units to pair with Xiangli Yao, who’s one of the best Electro DPS in Wuthering Waves . Yinlin can also carry the Moonlit Clouds set alongside the Impermanence Heron echo, which gives her the ability to further buff the next character’s ATK and DMG%.

3 Zhezhi

S-Tier

As a Sub-DPS unit who doesn’t spend that much time on the field, Zhezhi has one of the best off-field DPS in Wuthering Waves . When casting her Resonance Liberation, Zhezhi will start launching coordinated attacks alongside on-field characters. Not only that, but Zhezhi also operates as a battery for the unit that joins the field after her departure, restoring 15 of their Resonance Energy.

As for buffs, Zhezhi provides a strong 20% and 25% extra DMG to the next unit’s Glacio and Resonance Skill DMG, respectively, making her an excellent unit to pair with Jinhsi and Carlotta, who are the best DPS in Wuthering Waves . On top of all that, Zhezhi works Moonlit Clouds set and the Impermanence Heron echo.

2 Verina

S-Tier

Before the Shorekeeper, Verina was one of the most favorite Supports in Wuthering Waves . In fact, Verina is very similar to the Shorekeeper and almost matches her healing and buffs during combat.

Verina can heal her entire team continuously through her coordinated attacks. She also cast multiple DMG and ATK% buffs from her kit and Echoes set. As a standard 5-star unit, Verina is definitely one of the best Supports in Wuthering Waves .

1 Shorekeeper

S-Tier

One of the best Supports in Wuthering Waves . The Shorekeeper is a decent buffer who can raise her team’s Crit value on top of her continuous healing. Her kit allows her to join any team, and she will perform incredibly well.

Healing allies allow the Shorekeeper to carry the Rejuvenating Glow Echoes set, which further helps her buff the team’s ATK%. Players who pulled for this top-tier Support definitely hit the jackpot.
